snippet: A club founded in 1933 on the bedrock of segregation is obviously not so easily rebuilt — or even touched.
abstract: Karen Crouse On Golf column; Augusta National Golf Club chairman Billy Payne refuses to answer questions about the men-only club allowing women admission, while trying to explain how to make golf more attractive to a younger demographic.
lead_paragraph: A club founded in 1933 on the bedrock of segregation is obviously not so easily rebuilt — or even touched.

headline.seo: Uncomfortable Day at the Augusta National Boys Club
headline.main: Touchy Day at Augusta National Men’s Club
headline.print_headline: Touchy Day At Augusta National Men’s Club
